node.display_long_description:
Watch Colette, an Oscar®-nominated documentary short following one of the last surviving members of the WWII French Resistance on Oculus TV today!

Oculus TV is a VR home for the best in immersive entertainment where you’re always at the center of the action. Get access to award-winning interactive stories, as well as immersive TV, animation and photos. Our regularly-updated lineup includes a variety of genres including sci-fi, travel, sports and more.

nodes.title: Meet Your Carbon Footprint
nodes.body_text: Explore how our daily choices can feed or fight climate change. What we eat, how we get around, our energy use at home and the stuff we buy – it all links us to climate change. Your carbon footprint is the amount of greenhouse gases released to the atmosphere as a result of your consumption choices. In this video, you will confront your carbon footprint in real size. You will also experience sea level rise, smog, and wildfires – some of the impacts we are responsible for. But you will also discover how easy – and delicious – it is to live a climate friendly lifestyle. 3D art by Martin Nebelong Supported by Media Molecule and PlayStation as part of their commitment to the Playing for the Planet Alliance. Watch now on Oculus TV.

nodes.title: Climate Change in Fiji: Our Home, Our People
nodes.body_text: Vei lomani’ is a Fijian expression meaning ‘love in action’, and it is a value at the heart of Fijian life. And it is in the spirit of ‘vei lomani’ that Fijians are coming together to respond to the impacts of climate change. Experience the story of Catalina, Rai, Asmita and Rupeni in 360° VR. Watch now on Oculus TV.

node.reviewDescription:
The Samsung VR app was killed. And the current version of Oculus TV doesn't even have the very basic media gallery functionalities. 

Dear developers, here is short list of improvements that IMHO would make Oculus TV a perfect local media gallery app:

- Ability to browse files by folder, name or date (c'mon, this is very basic!).
- Ability to render cubemaps of any kind.
- Ability to render both full and half SBS still images and video.
- Ability to read .png images.
- Ability to render the other 20+ image types the old Samsung VR app was able to (including 180x101, planetary dome, rtpx, etc).  
- Ability to read suffix in the file name and render it accordingly (e.g. if the file name is xyz_mono360.png it automatically opens as a monoscopic 360 picture).

In summary, please add every local media functionality we lost when Samsung VR was removed from store.

ANY future improvements towards the goal above is much appreciated!
